channel.title: Welcome to ASG
channel.description: Caring for the children of the stars

item.title: Caring for the children of the stars
item.dc:creator: silinwang123
item.content:encoded:
There is such a group of children, they are like the twinkling stars in the distant sky, far away from our real life. Such children are called "children of the stars", "children of the stars" live in their own world like the stars in the sky . People describe autistic children like this: they are not deaf, but they are deaf to the sound; they are not blind, but they are blind to people and things around them; they are not dumb, but they don't know how to speak. They are like stars in the sky alone in a world, and they have a common name-children with autism. Every year, April 2 is the world "Autistic Child Care Day". For autism, misunderstanding and ignorance are often the biggest obstacles to social recognition and support. Children with autism should have equal opportunities for development. , Enjoy a normalized life.

In order to let more people understand and pay attention to children with autism, and let everyoneâ€™s love warm their loneliness, ASG calls on the whole society to pay attention to patients with autism, deepen societyâ€™s understanding of children with autism, and cultivate a conducive to The good social and cultural atmosphere for the healthy growth of special children provides them with a better social environment. Let us join hands to care for the children of these stars!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [contact-field label="åç§°" type="name" required="true" /] [contact-field label="ç”µå­é‚®ç®±" type="email" required="true" /] [contact-field label="ç½‘å€" type="url" /] [contact-field label="é‚®ä»¶" type="textarea" /]

item.dc:creator: silinwang123
item.content:encoded:
Adultsâ€™ Group for People with ASD

Formed in November 2010, the group meets on the first Saturday of the month around 6:00pm. The meet-up provides an opportunity for adults with ASD to interact with one another and other community members.

The Adolescentsâ€™ Group

Formed in April 2010, a social group of young people aged between 12 to 17 years meets on the last Sunday of the month. Activities include cooking, handicrafts, xbox gaming and a variety of board games.

IT Group

Recently formed! If you are in high school or a young adult (to age 20), interested in game design, social media or web design. You may like to join a group of other like-minded young people to learn more and share ideas in technology. This group will meet from 2:00 pm â€“ 4:00 pm on the second Sunday of the month.

Brothers and Sisters (or Siblings) Group

Open to all school-age children who have a sister or brother who is on the autism spectrum. This group meets once a term to renew friendships and to share, through social outings and play, what it means to have a brother or sister with autism. These social outings are often conducted during school vacation periods.

Coffee Morning

Every last Friday of the month from 10 am to noon at McDonaldâ€™s, the group hosts coffee morning for parents and others interested in autism to share their experiences and learn more about autism.

item.title: BLOG
item.dc:creator: silinwang123
item.content:encoded:
Autism, also known as autism, is a severe generalized developmental disorder of infants. Children with typical symptoms will appear before the age of three. Essential interpersonal communication difficulties prevent them from establishing normal interpersonal relationships with other people, even their parents, using language, expressions, and movements. The concept of autism was proposed and determined by American psychiatrist Leo Kanner in 1943. But the phenomenon of autism existed before its concept was confirmed. It can be said that autism has a long past. <Details>

Causeï¼šThe cause of autism has not yet been fully elucidated. It may be related to the following factors, or it may develop under the combined action of multiple factors. 1. Genetic factors: Some children are related to genetic factors, and the role of genetic factors on autism has become clear. Among the siblings of children with this disease, 2% to 6% suffer from the disease. 36%.<Details>

Early intervention for autismï¼šChildhood autism is a widespread developmental disorder. Autism usually starts before the age of three. So far, the cause of autism has not been understood, but studies have found that childhood autism is a biologically based disease that is highly related to genetic inheritance. Although we currently donâ€™t have an immediate and effective treatment method, it is not without a cure for autism. <Details>

Diagnostic criteriaï¼šAccording to page 299 of the Fourth Edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, autism is defined as: A: has the following six characteristics (1), (2) and (3), of which at least two are from (1), (2) ) And (3) each have one item: (1) Lack of social skills, manifested in the lack of eye contact and no eye contact in at least two of the following. <Details>

item.excerpt:encoded: Adult and kid hands holding colorful heart on blue background. World autism awareness day concept.
